Position Description:

We are looking for a Data Scientist that understands public health and surveillance to be an integral part of our team designing and deploying a next generation active surveillance solution. This individual needs to be a leader participating in the requirements and design of a new active surveillance system. They will look at the CDC’s desired results and define the data requirements from the bottom up. This individual will be responsible for supporting our clinical leadership reporting the results to the surveillance system and reporting to a variety of interested stakeholders. If you want to be part of a leadership team changing how active surveillance is performed in health conditions that are of national importance, this is the right opportunity for you.

Your future duties and responsibilities:

Participate in a diverse team of engineers, anaysts and domain experts.
  • Participate in the analysis of the functional and business needs of the customer to develop system requirements, solution design and oversight to validate the solution meets the customer’s expectations.
  • Drive the data requirements for the solution thinking of the reporting end results such as supporting statistical analysis, peer review published paper and presentation to variouis CDC executives and Epidemiologists. Consideration is also given to helping the CDC translate the data into public health actionable response.
  • Contribute to customer reporting (status reports, EPLC, etc.)
  • Participate in the solution deployment, communication and working with various clinical respresentatives and government officials
  • Meet with the customer regularly to obtain continual buy-in of the solution and approval throughout the development, delivery and implementation process.
  • Need excellent people skills and works effectively with a team
  • Requires excellent communication skills (verbal and written)


Required qualifications to be successful in this role:

• Minimum 8 years of relevant experience
  • Master’s degree in a related discipline
  • Analyze business requirements, user experience and develop recommendations for improvement.
  • Expert knowledge of SAS, Python or R
  • Working knowledge of statistics, programming and predictive modeling.
  • Working knowledge of code writing
  • Perform usability review and stability testing with users
  • Experience developing and implementing data requirements for a new solution that evolved from concept to deployment
  • Experience working in an Agile environment
  • Strong client interaction experience
  • Strong written and oral communication skills
  • Due to the nature of the government contract requirements and/or clearance requirements US citizenship is required?
Desired qualifications:
  • Experience working on The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) projects especially with an emphasis on chronic diseases
  • Knowledge of public health and active surveillance systems
  • Familiarity with Jira, and CDC EPLC process
